segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes like nothing is wrong, but the kitchen is flooding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the sink, and she doesn’t even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she’s so focused on that plate that she doesn’t notice the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is spreading, and the floor must be slippery by now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever this oblivious in other parts of her life.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are behind her, taking cookies, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she turns around soon and sees what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is soaking the cabinets, and it’s only going to get worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything is falling apart around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice the water or if she’ll just keep drying dishes forever.
segments.speaker: PAR
